intro: Gongora armeniaca, commonly known as the Armenian nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. Gongora armeniaca typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its foliage consists of broad, dark green leaves that are often covered in a fine, pubescent layer.
